newsitem.title: USA: MFA changing name to Managed Funds Association.
newsitem.headline: MFA changing name to Managed Funds Association.

text.p: The Managed Futures Association (MFA) said Wednesday it will change its name to Managed Funds Association to better reflect the wide range of cash and derivative markets used by its members.
MFA's board approved the name change, which will become effective by yearend, at its April 23 meeting, the group said.
MFA's board also voted to cut costs by closing its Palo Alto, Calif, business office and consolidating those functions in its Washington, DC, government relations office.
MFA, formed in 1991, has some 660 members involved in investment management and trading. ((DerivativesDesk(312)408-8750)) E-mail:derivatives@reuters.com
